connector.description: Send and rececive messages to/from STOMP (Simple Text Oriented Messaging Protocol) compliant message brokers.

camel.source.endpoint.brokerURL.name: camel.source.endpoint.brokerURL
camel.source.endpoint.brokerURL.description: The URI of the Stomp broker to connect to

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.stomp.brokerURL.name: camel.component.stomp.brokerURL
camel.component.stomp.brokerURL.description: The URI of the Stomp broker to connect to

camel.component.stomp.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.stomp.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.stomp.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.stomp.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.stomp.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.stomp.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.stomp.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.component.stomp.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.stomp.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.stomp.useGlobalSslContex.name: camel.component.stomp.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.stomp.useGlobalSslContex.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
